text:
A partnership between seven
hospital organizations had come together

to implement a common CIS,
the Epic Clinical Information System.

And in working with AWS,
we found that world-class partner,

providing cloud services to support
the clinical and administrative systems

that we were supplying
and building out for our 14 hospitals.

It has delivered both in terms
of performance, in terms of scalability,

in terms of cost management,
and also improved our security footprint.

Specifically looking
at our clinical information system,

in the disaster recovery environment,
we were able to achieve the RPO,
recovery point objective,

and the RTO, recovery time objective,
that we had set for our hospital cluster.
What is unique about the solution

that we deployed for our Epic Disaster
Recovery Environment

is that, instead of having to build out
and run the whole DR environment

at scale, we operate a minimum set,
so we call it a pilot light.

This allows us to maintain a subset
of services on a 24x7 basis,

and then scale out on demand
as needed in the event of a disaster.

We had projected about a $10 million
savings over the course of 10 years.

Here we are two years into it, and our run
rate and what we have seen has lived up

to the expectations of what was forecasted
when we embarked upon this journey.

Healthcare has often been looked
at as an industry that moves slowly.

And I think what we've been able to prove and
demonstrate here is, with the support of AWS,

we have in fact moved quickly
and have been leaders in the space.
